tourBios.carHigh: 2012: Has missed the cut in all four of his starts. Shot 71-72 at the Chile Classic but missed the cut by two strokes...Won a playoff in early February at a Gateway Pro Tour event in Buckeye, Ariz., his third career victory on that circuit. Only TOUR start came in the 2006 Waste Management Phoenix Open, where he missed the cut.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Placed second in 1996 Northern California State High School ChampionshipâŚTeam won the Northern California state title in 1995 and 1997...Was a 1998 first-team All-America pick by the AJGA and 1997 third-team selection. Was also the Northern California Junior Golfer of the Year.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill in golf was playing in the 2006 Waste Management Phoenix Open...Is a fan of the San Francisco Giants and attended numerous San Francisco spring training games while he was a student at Arizona State. Likes watching San Francisco Giants' closer Brian Wilson pitch...Among his Arizona State teammates during his four years were Paul Casey, Jeff Quinney, Matt Jones, Chez Reavie and Alejandro Canizares...Watches "Entourage" and likes the movie "Anchorman."Favorite gadget is his computer. Favorite vacation spot is his couch...Not many people know that he hates talking on the phone...Finished third in the under-8 category at the Florida Pitch, Putt and Drive competition at age 5...Earned his black belt in taekwando, a martial art he studied between ages 5 and 13. He stopped when he began concentrating on golf...Has a dog he picked up from the pound, Kayla, a Rhodesian ridgeback, labrador, pit bull terrier mix...Learned the game from his grandfather and became serious about the sport when his family lived in Jacksonville, Fla., adjacent to Hidden Hills CC...Sister, Alisha Stockton Chwala, is his manager...Is no relation to PGA TOUR and Champions Tour veteran Dave Stockton.
